thread.title: Macy's sells top four floors of downtown Seattle location
thread.title_full: Macy's sells top four floors of downtown Seattle location - seattlepi.com

author: DANIEL DEMAY, SEATTLEPI.COM STAFF
title: Macy's sells top four floors of downtown Seattle location
text:
The downtown Seattle Macy's store will be four floors shy of what it has been after the store closed a deal to sell floors five through eight for $65 million.
In the Friday announcement, Macy's said the 300,000 square feet of space was "underutilized" and will be converted to office space by the buyer, Starwood Capital Group.
Macy's said the store will stay open, and it plans to remodel the space it's keeping by fall of next year.
"Macy's on Pine Street is a very successful business serving a thriving community of downtown residents and workers," said Terry J. Lundgren, Macy's, Inc. chairman and chief executive officer, in a Friday news release. "Our vision is to make the store easier and quicker to navigate while also attracting new jobs and economic activity to space that has not been fully utilized in recent years."
The 265 downtown store employees don't have to worry about losing their jobs, but some may be reassigned as space changes in some departments, the release said.
The downtown building first opened at The Bon Marche in 1929 and totals 864,000 square feet of space. The nameplate was changed to Macy's in 2006.
Daniel DeMay covers Seattle culture, business and transportation for seattlepi.com. He can be reached at 206-448-8362 or danieldemay@seattlepi.com. Follow him on Twitter: @Daniel_DeMay.
